Ingredients:
3 cups bread flour
1-2 cups water (at room temerature)
1/4 teaspoon (0.8g) instant yeast
1-2/3 teaspoon (10g) salt

Instructions:
Proof the yeast in 2 tablespoons warm water. Mix all ingredients. Place in well oiled container, covered for 8-12 hours. 
The dough will be moist and sticky, for shaping you need to scrape it onto a well- floured surface, and lightly flour the top before patting it down gently. Then use a bench scraper to help lift it for shaping. Latex gloves work wonderfully to keep it from sticking to your fingers if youâ€™re not comfortable with handling super sticky doughs.
Set the shaped dough on a coarse-weave towel sprinkled amply with bran. No need to sprinkle the top as it should have enough flour from the counter.
Let rise for another 1.5-2 hours. I baked in stone ware covered with aluminum foil at 450F./230C for 20 minutes, 10 minutes lid off, transferred to a baking sheet and 10 minutes more.
